definition: to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: He ought not to have stopped his work halfway.
sentences.chinese: 他本不應該做這項事情時功敗垂成。

sentences.english: This way you don't overextend your economy and then fizzle out with nothing left.
sentences.chinese: 這樣你就不會開始過分發展經濟，最後功敗垂成了。

sentences.english: There's many a slip between the cup and the lip! Who knows what may happen.
sentences.chinese: 事情往往功敗垂成，誰知道將會發生什麼。

sentences.english: Any close to was not answered correctly, likely suffer defeat on the verge of victory.
sentences.chinese: 任何一關沒有正確應對，都可能功敗垂成。
